intro: Mouretia guangdongensis, commonly known as Guangdong mouretia, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its genus.
